trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.TreeNodeCheckChanged"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.TreeNodeCollapsed"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.TreeNodeDataBound"></xref>, <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.TreeNodeExpanded"></xref>, and <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView.TreeNodePopulate"></xref> events of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeView"></xref> control.
The TreeNodeEventArgs class is used to store the event data that is passed to an event-handling method.
For a list of the initial property values for an instance of the TreeNodeEventArgs class, see <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs.%23ctor%28System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode%29>.
For more information about handling events, see [NIB: Consuming Events](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/01e4f1bc-e55e-413f-98c7-6588493e5f67).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> object.
Use the TreeNodeEventArgs constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs> class.
> [!NOTE] > The TreeNodeEventArgs constructor is used primarily by control developers when raising events.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNodeEventArgs> class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> that represents the current node when the event is raised.
Gets the node that raised the event.
Use the Node property to access the properties of the node that raised the event.

The Node property returns a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode> object and is commonly used to determine the contents of the node, to modify the properties of the node, or to add child nodes dynamically.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.TreeNode"></xref> that represents the node that raised the event.
